title: Riot ban system
body:
So I made a smurf account to play with my friend who just started the game, and someone was trolling me so I called them a fag. Then I realized my error and that I would probably get chat restricted, so I thought "whatever, it's just a smurf account". A few minutes after the game, I got temp banned for 2 weeks. I was confused because I never had any infractions up until that point (new account). So I sent Riot a ticket asking them why I got temp banned, and they said it's because they have 0 tolerance for hate speech.

That's so fucking stupid. Being toxic is being toxic. It shouldn't matter what you say, everything should be punished equally. Everything you say are just words, none of them have more meaning than others. If I said the n word and a bunch of people got mad at me for it, then they're the ones making the situation worse. They're giving the word the power that they so desperately want it to not have. (idubbbz quote) But seriously though, if you're going to temp ban me for "hate speech", then ban every other person who has ever been toxic. Don't chat restrict some people and ban others, they're all toxic, give them the same punishment. Fuck you Riot, fix your system.

First of all, to hell with feelings when it comes to the internet, when you go online you kinda sign a contract that you are willingly exposing yourself to this sorta thing, idc if I seem like a "douchebag", I'm just giving it to you straight.

Regular toxicity is different, and it gives you more time to correct your behavior before the hammer comes down: the punishment system works on 4 tiers. The first is a 10 game chat restriction, then a 25 game. After that is a 14 day ban, and then a permaban. It doesn't matter what the amount of toxicity is, if you continue to be toxic, eventually you will be permabanned. When you're on the 14 day ban, all it take is one instance of validated toxicity to get your account permabanned.

However, these rules are thrown out the window in instance of hate speech, something Riot has a zero tolerance policy for (and calls to self harm but that doesn't apply here). One offence can take you from nothing to a 14 day ban.
I realized that. And I know the punishment tiers. I just don't get why some words are more offensive to riot than others.
